chunks.text: Now we will solve a small question, the name of the question is sum of a and b
We have to define two variables, one variable will be of integer type
Which we will name as a, we will store some value in a, suppose we have stored 10
So what we did with this statement, we defined an integer variable of a, in which we have stored value 10
Second thing we have to do is, we have to define another variable b, in b we have to store some other value
Suppose we have stored 5, so here we have made an int type variable b, in which we have stored value 5
After that we have to find out the sum of these two, so to find out the sum we will make a third variable
Its type will also be int, we will name it as sum, or we can name it as c, d or x
Here we have given sum name, because we have to keep the name of variables logical
This will help us a lot in interviews, because those programmers are very impressive
Whose variables names are logical, means after reading the variable we can understand what is stored in the variable
Now what is the sum, we know that if it was math, then what we would have done
In math we know that int a is equal to 10, b is equal to 5, so we would have written c is equal to a plus b
So the same thing will happen here, we will write a plus b and then our statement terminator
So what will happen by this, a and b both will be calculated and will come under our sum variable
Let's see its visualization in memory, as soon as we execute this first line, similarly in memory
A variable will be formed, in which value will be stored as 10, similarly in memory b variable will be formed
In which value will be 5, similarly we will execute this line, int sum is equal to a plus b
So first of all we will bring the sum of a in memory, which is 10, then compiler will find b value
If it will bring this value, then value of b and a will be added and it will become 15
Now we have to make a new variable in memory which is sum, so here somewhere else a variable named sum will be formed
In which total value of both of them will be stored as 15, and then we can print this sum
Here we will write print statement and then sum, for this sum code, we will remove the old code from existing class
And first of all we will define our variable a, int a is equal to 10, then we will write int b is equal to 5
Finally we will make third variable, sum is equal to a plus b and then we will print the value of our sum
What we will write, system.out.println, then we will write sum inside, we will save this
Now we will run the same thing from terminal and now sum is printed for us which is 15
What we did internally, a little revision, we created 10 in memory, created 5 in memory
Then we stored sum of a and b which is 10 and 5 which is 15 inside sum and finally we printed it by system.out.println
